titleInfo.title: Route from Cumberland House to the Athaperscow Lake, North America, surveyed by the Northern Land expedition under the command of Lieu't Franklin, R. N.

mods.note: Photocopy of a reproduction (1919 and 19--) of Frankins maps from January to the shores of the Polar Sea (1818-1820).

Title vignette: "This survey was conducted in the same manner as the former. Its includes the winter journey of M. Franklin & Back, and the summer track of the canoes. The observation and encampments? of the winter party are marked in red to distinguish them from the others. The River Saskatchewan is laid drawn from Mr. ... observations and a surrey made by Dr. Richardson ... excursion in the spring of 1820. Fort Enterprise, March 1820".
"C.O. Canada No. 79 (2)" in upper right for Colonial Office - Canada".
"Copied by C. Pettigrew at P.R.O. Sept. 1919" and "A correct copy H.P. Biggar 27 ... 19--." in lower right.
Includes table of distances between locations by canoe & overland.
Descriptive observations of landscape along route.
